title: Firefox sync restoring bookmarks from infrequently used devices
content: I have 3 desktops and 2 laptops with Firefox sync turned on. Occasionally the bookmarks on all devices are synced with an older version of bookmarks. I'm guessing it's from one of the laptops that hasn't been turned on in a few weeks and now is on. Is there not a way to prevent an old set of bookmarks from replacing a known 'good' set of bookmarks? Thankfully I have my bookmarks backup turned on and can restore them but would like to know if there is a solution to keeping bookmarks current and stable on all devices, even those devices that aren't regularly used.
creator: markandlyndon

title: Continuous blocking when I surf the web
content: I try to like firefox and once upon a time I did like it. Now it seems it spends more time trying to prottect me and annoy me than anything else. Either images don't load, or if I'm on my laptop it won't let me access mic and video for a conference call. The thing is, I have AVG I have ad blocker I know my way around them and yet FF keeps getting in my way I turn those app and extension off/on and I'm just ANNOYED. Finally I just uninstall the mothersucker. I don't even know I have a question.....Oh yes, I want a clean simple fast browser that doesnt infantilize me or make me wear a helmet if I don't want to. I'm not a new user by any means, but this browser just bugs the shit out of me. Upshot I've gone back to Chrome as my default browser.

title: aggiunta di un nuovo dispositivo di sicurezza
content: Ho ricevuto come tanti altri la nuova tessera sanitaria con sigla ST2021 ,mi sono subito apprestato a configurare il computer per poterla usare per i vari servizi offerti.Il percorso è: istallare il driver consigliato( nel mio caso Safedive 2020.pkg per macOS regione Toscana)dopo configurare Firefox,(preferenze_Privacy & Sicurezza_dispositivi di sicurezza,caricare nuovo modulo Pkcs#11 che lo troviamo nel driver istallato in precedenza e si chiama "LbstPKCS11.dylib" dato l'Ok,la risposta è "IMPOSSIBILE CARICARE IL MODULO". Chiedo cortesemente se qualcuno si trova nelle mie stesse condizioni e se ha trovato modo di risolvere il caso. Ho chiesto in giro e tutti con sistema macOS hanno rilevato il problema,ho chiesto supporto alla regione e non sanno dare una spiegazione anche il supporto Apple nulla.Forse l'unica potrebbe essere la ST Microelettronics colei che ha fatto i Cip della carta e il driver.Ho scritto anche a loro ma non ho avuto risposta. Ringrazio in anticipo per il possibile aiuto. Cordialmente I.F.
creator: iliofa

title: Firefox & Chrome Do Not Open Website Horizontally but Dropdown or Vertically
content:
12232022

I have Firefox Browser 96.0.2 (64-bit) and Google Chrome Version 97.0.4692.99 (Official Build) (x86_64). installed in my MacBook Pro early 2013 macOS Catalina Version 10.15.7. And I've got this error message, "Warning! Internet Explorer should not be used for proper operation of the Administrator Backend" when I opened my website, ulattime.com/ulattime/administrator," which opens vertically or downward or dropdown, instead of "horizontally" and I don't have "Internet Explorer" browser. Please see screenshot, https://imgur.com/zNMVSSf. I used FireFox and Chrome either as default and had now removed it as default as the same error message happened when I used these browsers. I went to “Network Setting” of Firefox and tried “Manual proxy configuration” and I also enabled “DNS over HTTPS” and “Use Provider” “Cloudfare”(Default) and “NextDNS” and “Custom” but nothing happened. But in Safari, my website opens "horizontally" so I am keeping Safari as my default browser for now. If Firefox or Chrome opens "horizontally," I can restore either of them as my default browser again. Thank you.

Joseph Lariosa ontherecord@ulattime.com
creator: ontherecord

title: WebSockets fails to send large chunks of data
content: I really love firefox, but since the recent update that came with a cool multi-colour theme, websockets have been having issues on my browser. I'm a developer, and currently building a site that's very much based on this websockets protocol. The issue is, when transmitting a huge chunk of data (e.g large json of google auth details), firefox tends to send a corrupted payload which the server cannot decode. This issue doesn't appear in Chrome for some reason.
